Property.Description: Defines the number of gain handles for the HI. The numbers in parentes describes the levels for the gain handles.
If set to 1, the Compression Ratio can be set to 5. Otherwise to 3.

Defines the filter order for AFXDFS. For normal BTE device, the feedback path complexity can be handled by 16 order filter, for some other form factor such as Reno, higher order filter need to be used to handle feedback path, therefore 20 order filter is used.
Defines the adaptive reference filter for AFXDFS. For Reno form factor, we should set it to 'On' and for other form factor it should be 'Off'.

Defines the High Frequency Shift setting for AFXDFS. It is a setting specific for Reno(or other form factor which has complex in feedback path) form factor. For normal form factor, it should be set to 'Off'.
Define the Interleave Enable Rules for different AFXDFS modes. This is an MIPS optimization. It should be set to On for all AFXDFS mode.
Defines the mechanical form factor of device. The option is used to configure different AFXDFS behavior to adapt to different form factors.
Controls the telecoil noise reduction algorithm. The option is used for some form factor which has frame rate noise.
Controls the overflow level for the TCNR algorithm. Some form factor may need a different parameter.
Controls the DAI noise reduction algorithm. The option is used for some form factor which has frame rate noise.

Setting this property will affect judgement of link break. Higher value means more conservative behaviour and small value will be more active. Use default value in most case only for form factor which has bad wireless performance. Consult Algo before making adjustment.

Setting this property will affect the speed of fade in/out other side data. Use default value in most case only for form factor which has bad wireless performance. Consult Algo before making adjustment.

Setting this property will affect the judgement of the link status, longer time interval means more tolerant and shorter means critical behavior. Use default value in most case only for form factor which has very bad wireless performance. Consult Algo before making adjustment.

This property defines which Frequency Lowering Levels will be available in the Fitting Software to select and for each Level which Frequency Compression Kneepoint and Frequency Compression Ratio will be used. Make sure the Levels are increasing integers, the Kneepoints are chosen from the possible Kneepoints and the Compression Ratios are chosen from the possible Compression Ratios.
Controls the telecoil noise reduction algorithm. The option is used for some form factor which has frame rate noise.
Define if the Antialiasing filter is applied during DFS initialization
